conclusion: Analyze forces on coil when current is passed and reversed to find magnetic induction intensity B.
Magnetic force on coil when current flows is F = n * I * L * B.
Initially, balance achieved without additional mass when current flows in one direction.
Reversing current reverses magnetic force direction; additional mass m added to left pan provides gravitational force F_g = m * g.
Additional gravitational force F_g must equal twice magnetic force F: m * g = 2 * n * I * L * B.
Solve for B: B = (m * g) / (2 * n * I * L).
Magnitude of magnetic induction intensity B is B = (m * g) / (2 * n * I * L).
